title: Fix invalid memory access for non-force-probed get_connector calls
body:
So it turns out not releasing a new drm-rs version right away and testing it is a bit was a good decision.

Not only did we get #119 done and merged beforehand, but I also missed an invalid memory access (uuups...).

If the connector has only one advertised mode (as is the case for some laptop apparently), the kernel will try to fill a non-existing buffer, when we initially request the sizes, we thus need to use a temporary variable to be able to store it.

Additionally, if downstream would have been using get_connector from the drm-ffi trait directly without requesting modes, we would have done an implicit force-probe anyway, so we need to special case modes a bit to handle this case correctly.

title: Use dynamic allocations
body:
After the discussion in #121 we concluded, that the current approach of using fixed length static slices for querying dynamic resources inside drm-rs is suboptimal and error-prone.

Commit 1 replaces all questionable uses of this pattern with `Vec`s. This results in some code being simplified.

Commit 2 is just exposing to variables we always queried, but were never readable by the user.

Commit 3 supersedes #121 by fixing the original issue described in there.

@Slabity A review on the first commit would be nice, given the amount of changes. I am feeling fairly certain with the rest.

title: Add support for waiting for vblanks
body:
- The Linux and FreeBSD bindings for the vblank flags are slightly different (although the values are the same), so I have just defined them manually. I did try using `cfg` to define them conditionally based upon the target OS, but it was getting a bit messy.
- The signal and flip flags don't do anything useful so I have omitted these, although curiously the signal number is copied into vblank event as the user data, so I have put that in the API.
- The secondary flag is equivalent to setting `high_crtc=1`, so I have omitted this.

title: Add support for retrieving planar frame buffers
body:
Planar formats (such as compressed formats) cannot be retrieved via the existing method.

Some things to consider for review:
- Unlike `Info`, `PlanerInfo` does not derive `Hash` because `UnrecognizedFourcc` does not derive `Hash`.
- `Info` does not have a function exposing `buffer`; is this intentional?
- `PlanarInfo.buffers` uses `buffer::Handle` instead of `framebuffer::Handle` so it may be passed to `control::buffer_to_prime_fd`.
- The ioctl struct returns four modifier values. I have taken after libdrm which ignores all but the first.

title: Use Xrgb8888 and fix depth in examples
Fix mode type flags
body: Mode type is in mode.type_, not mode.flags

title: Update bindings
body: Bindings should be updated to be consistent with latest changes

title: Migrate enum arrays to the bitflags crate
body:
Depends on #102

`bitflags` is the "de-facto standard" crate when it comes to representing bitfields in an easy manner, and providing the necessary tooling around it.  It allows to easily construct and compare combinations of flags without having to fall back to casts and slices of individual flag bits.  In addition the type documents and guards possible values, giving a more ergonomic user-experience overall.

This still needs the documentation added in some places.

title: property/control: Support non-linear enum->string conversion
body:
On a driver where certain properties not necessarily start at zero, such as an Intel card with the "scaling mode" property omitting the `None` variant and only describing the values 1, 2, and 3, translating a value of 3 ("Full aspect") runs into an index-out-of-bounds panic.  Similarly many properties present an unsorted array of values.

Both problems are solved by initially checking whether the value is out of bounds and otherwise comparing if that value interpreted as index yields the same value from the values array - this is merely a performance optimization and if not, the actual index for that value needs to be linearly scanned before the translation to its string representation can be made.

---

Alternatively a `BTreeMap` could be constructed to simplify the lookup, but it seems drm-rs prefers to postpone the cost of such "expensive" objects/translation to moment it's used instead. It doesn't allow the `values[value] == value` optimization either which is by far the most common enum representation.

title: drm-ffi: Add getfb2 ioctl support
body:
This ioctl was added in Linux 5.7, and lets a DRM master access a previous framebuffer, no matter its format.  This can be used for smooth handoff between different DRM masters, even with modifiers, multiple planes, etc.

Edit: requires #97 to be merged for CI to complete.
